org.jetel.graph

Class ConcurrentOutputPort

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.graph.ConcurrentOutputPort
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OutputPort, OutputPortDirect

    public class ConcurrentOutputPort
extends java.lang.Object
implements OutputPortDirect
    Simple wrapper around common direct output port. Only additional value is synchronized record writing. It is highly recommended to use writeRecordDirect instead of non-direct version - the synchronization block is significantly shorter if the record serialization is done out of this output port.

      • writeRecordDirect

        public void writeRecordDirect(CloverBuffer record)
                       throws java.io.IOException,
                              java.lang.InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: OutputPortDirect
        An operation that passes/writes one record through this port.
        The passed-in object (CloverBuffer) must be ready to be read - i.e. CloverBuffer.position() should be 0 and CloverBuffer.limit() should be pointing to the end of data in the buffer.
        Specified by:
        writeRecordDirect in interface OutputPortDirect
        Parameters:
        record - CloverBuffer containing the data to be written/sent
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If writing failed during method call
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If thread waiting to be notified was interrupted
